questions.question_text: What is the frequency to create a compliance report? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
BD

Tested on Prisma (tricky question, what do you mean with "fequency"?)

Frequency: One time, Recurring
Time Interval: Day, Week, Month.

Selected Answer: C
C

On Prisma Cloud, you can enable single sign-on (SSO) using an Identity Provider (IdP) that supports Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML), such as Okta, Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS), Azure Active Directory (AD), Google, or OneLogin. You can configure only one IdP for all the cloud accounts that Prisma Cloud monitors.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/manage-prisma-cloud-administrators/setup-sso-integration-on-prisma-cloud

Selected Answer: C
"You can configure only one IdP for all the cloud accounts that Prisma Cloud monitors."

questions.question_text: When configuring SSO how many IdP providers can be enabled for all the cloud accounts monitored by Prisma Cloud?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Tested on Prisma.

A --> To configure Splunk notifications, at least one Splunk Integration is needed.
C --> To configure Amazon SQS notifications, at least one Amazon SQS integration is needed. Please create an Amazon SQS Integration (in Settings > Integrations > Amazon SQS).

B --> There isn't any integrations like this QROC.
D --> Email no need any integrations.

A C
B - not couse there is no such integration like QROC
D - not couse: "For all channels except email, to enable notification of policy violations in your cloud environments in your existing operational workflows, you must Configure External Integrations on Prisma Cloud."

questions.question_text: Which two services require external notifications to be enabled for policy violations in the Prisma Cloud environment? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Environment Variable
Value
C
SQS_QUEUE_NAME
A string that represents the name of the SQS queue that you created in step 1. For example, Queue2_Policy_UUID.

A
API_ENDPOINT
Your Prisma Cloud API subdomain. For example, if your tenant is https://api.prismacloud.io , then the API_ENDPOINT will be api.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/prisma-cloud-iam-security/remediate-alerts-for-iam-security

questions.question_text: Which two variables must be modified to achieve automatic remediation for identity and access management (IAM) alerts in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Custom rule with specific configuration for networking
choices.C: Default rule that alerts on capabilities
choices.D: Default rule that alerts on suspicious runtime behavior
choices.A: Custom rule with specific configuration for file integrity

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
For exclusion D.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/runtime_defense/runtime_audits
Yes, D is the correct answer.

questions.question_text:
An administrator sees that a runtime audit has been generated for a host.
The audit message is:
`Service postfix attempted to obtain capability SHELL by executing /bin/sh /usr/libexec/postfix/postfix-script.stop. Low severity audit, event is automatically added to the runtime model`
Which runtime host policy rule is the root cause for this runtime audit?
